page.title: 02HARBY C OF E PRIMARY SCHOOL.
page.content: Harby Primary School is a Church of England controlled school. Originally, built in 1860 as a National School at a cost of nearly Â£1,000,the school was extended in 1974 to accommodate up to 120 pupils.During June 1985 there were 57 children on roll. The accommodation includes four teaching areas,an art area,studio,kiln room,library,resoures room,staff room, office and kitchen.The Village Institute is used for PE and games. There are two playgrounds and a field. {The teachers are Mr.Hammond,(head) , {Mrs.Barrett,Miss Prime,plus a nursery {nurse,Miss Berry.The chairman of the {school governors is Rev.J.Savige. At the age of 10 pupils transfer to Belvoir High School,Bottesford.At 14 they go to Melton Upper School. The second and third year pupils wrote the entries for this Domesday"D block"
